breweries.name: Brewer's Art
breweries.description: Set in a grand Mt. Vernon townhouse, The Brewer's Art offers many temptations for your palate. Our seasonally-influenced menu of European-style country fare features meats, fish, seafood, pasta, and vegetarian offerings.  Dinner is served daily between 5:30pm - 9:00pm (later on Thursdays, Fridays and Saturdays) and light fare is available from 4:00pm - 11:00pm. Our creative pastry chef prepares our homemade desserts. In addition to brewing our fine beers on the premises, we offer a carefully picked selection of beers and fine wines from around the world, and one of Baltimore's best selections of scotches and spirits.

data.name: Summer Ale
data.description: Pours pale gold, while our Angram beer engine helps give the beer a fluffy white cap of foam. Aromas of orchard fruit and doughy bread greet the senses, while light hop notes become more prevalent. Moderate bitterness leads on the palate, while jam, citrus, and toasted bread come into focus. The light body keeps you coming back for more, and the dry, bitter finish continues to build, leaving a surprisingly resinous aftertaste.

data.description: Back East Summer Ale is light in color, cloudy, and delicate in body but packed with hoppy goodness.  Brewed and dry-hopped with a blend Citra, Galaxy, and Simcoe hops, it is assertively hopped but not overly bitter, yet bursts with fruity, spicy, and herbal hop overtones.

breweries.name: Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery
breweries.description:
Our brewers eat, drink and sleep beer. They’re equal parts scientist, artist and beer geek. So, while every Rock Bottom brewer is passionate about their craft, they also put their own signature into every beer.

In other words, there is a unique beer menu at every Rock Bottom in addition to our core line up of consistent flavor profiles that you can expect at any Rock Bottom you visit nationwide.

But, you’re thirsty and want to know what beers you can expect down here, right?

breweries.name: Cherry Street Brewing Cooperative
breweries.description:
Cherry Street started out as a little garage operation in the foothills of the Rockies and quickly spread and built up great community support. Initially being known as a cooperative, we established our identity as applying cooperative ideals to everyday life. These ideals focus on education, community, and sustainability. We are here for the community just as the community is here for us.

We are a crazy group of people who love to brew lots of beer and share our passion for brewing. Cherry Street always has something fresh and exciting to enjoy. We continue to come up with crazy off the wall recipes and experiment with unusual ingredients and wild yeast.

Based in Vickery Village of Cumming, we are in partnership with Rick Tanner’s Grille & Bar. Join us for a pint, or swing by the brewery for a tour.

data.name: Summer Hill Blonde
data.description: A vibrant blend of malted barley, oats and wheat gives this pale ale a higher malt profile than expected from its colour and strength. The careful selection of hops and yeast contributes to its aromas and complexity. You might detect a hint of pineapple or blackcurrant. This ale can be drunk chilled and is a perfect drink for summer.

breweries.name: The Friday Beer
breweries.description: From the heart of the Malvern Hills in rural Worcestershire, Friday Beer brings you a range of bottle-conditioned ales. From Elgar, to radar, to C S Lewis, Malvern has long been associated with excellence, and we strive to continue this tradition, with a relentless focus on quality, flavour and careful design that draws its inspiration from the Malvern Hills Area of Natural Beauty.

breweries.name: Mountain Toad Brewing
breweries.description: Mountain Toad Brewing is a craft brewery in our beautiful town of Golden, Colo. We have a small taproom and large beer garden where our community can come and enjoy our freshly brewed beers.  Our beer line up includes four flagship beers and up to six seasonal or small batch beers on tap at any given time.

data.name: Summer Lightning
data.description:
A trendsetter in the brewing industry; the original Summer ale brewed all year round. An extremely pleasant bitter, straw coloured beer with a terrific fresh, hoppy aroma. This, coupled with an intense bitterness, leads to an excellent long, dry finish. Probably the beer to receive the most awards in Britain!

Summer Lightning has an ABV of 5%

data.name: Summer Love Ale
data.description: With the sublime, earthy familiarity of noble, American and German hops backed up by fresh and clean German malts, Summer Love Ale ends with a surprising burst of lemony refreshment from fistfuls of American whole flower hops. Love Summer, now.

breweries.name: Victory Brewing Company
breweries.description: Having trained in Germany, we appreciate the artistic freedom we have here in the US. Here creativity is embraced by a fervent core of consumers and we are happy to serve that audience with our experience in traditional methods, selection of choice, often imported ingredients, and the best processing that technology can offer us. We relish the opportunity to please both ourselves and our audience with our flavorful creations.  We've invested more than our lives in this. Take a look at Victory Brewing Company's Beers.

data.name: SummerBright Ale
data.description:
The brewmaster's goal: the perfect ale for summertime quaffing, nothing more. Breck Brew's SummerBright is the result. The craftsman's touch combines white wheat, two row pale and munich malt with the pacific northwest's most intriguing hops to create a bright, clean ale ideal for picnicking, evenings on the screen porch and enjoying the whims of the summer breeze.

Yeast:Top Fermenting Ale Yeast
Malts:Two-row Pale, White Wheat Malt, Carapils Malt, Munich
Hops:Fuggles, Cascade, Willamette

breweries.name: Breckenridge Brewery
breweries.description: Breckenridge Brewery was founded in 1990 in Breckenridge, Colorado. In the past two plus decades Breckenridge Brewery has grown from a small 3,000-barrels-a-year brewpub to one of the most successful craft beer and restaurant companies in the nation. It now handcrafts more than 70,000 barrels of fresh beer annually and owns and operates five brewpubs and ale houses in the state of Colorado. For more information visit www.breckbrew.com.

breweries.name: Big Time Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Big Time's brewery is a 14 barrel JV Northwest system consisting of a gas fired brew kettle, an infusion mash tun with mixer, a hot liquor back, a wort cooler, (5) 14 barrel fermenters, (1) bright beer tank, and (20) 7 bbl serving tanks.  

We sell 85% of our beer at the pub but do wholesale a limited number of kegs to a dozen or so Seattle area taverns. We currently brew approximately 1,300 barrels of beer per year

data.name: Sunburn Summer Brew
data.description: Sunburn Summer Brew is a very smooth, refreshing, sessionable ale. Sunburn is light in color, body, and bitterness, but by no means light in flavor. Sunburn’s point of differentiation is that it delivers an abundance of flavor via the new hop called Citra. Citra is aptly named for its thirst quenching citrus flavor and aroma. Sunburn Summer Brew is lighter in alcohol, full in flavor with a crisp finish making this a great beer for any summer afternoon.

breweries.name: Widmer Brothers Brewing
breweries.description:
Widmer Brothers Brewing is located in beautiful and brew-friendly Portland, OR. Our publicly-held brewery employs over 150 people who are as passionate about quality craft beer as Kurt & Rob themselves.

We opened the brewery in 1984, and built a new 40-barrel brewing system in our current Russell Street location in 1990. We've grown steadily ever since. In 1996, we completed installation of a state-of-the art 250-barrel brewhouse, bringing our capacity to 220,000 barrels per year. In 1996, for the first time in our brewery’s history we also installed a bottling line, capable of producing 500 bottles per minute. In 2008 we added six new 1500-barrel fermentation tanks that increased our capacity to 450,000 barrels per year, and added a new keg filling line capable of filling 300 kegs per hour.

breweries.name: Packinghouse Brewing Company
breweries.description:
More than a century ago the California citrus industry was born in our own city of Riverside. The citrus boom rapidly brought much prosperity and attention to the entire region. The Packinghouse Brewing Company name is a nostalgic tribute to the area’s original citrus packinghouses and the hard working laborers that brought about California’s “Second Gold Rush”.

PBCo. is honored to carry on the same tradition of a strong work ethic and support to our community.

The founders of PBCo. have blended a respect for our local cultural heritage with a passion for finely crafted micro brews. The result is an offering of signature styles that are as rich as the cultural backdrop in which they were conceived.

breweries.name: Eudora Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Eudora Brewing Co. is Dayton's first and only brew-on-premises facility and nano-brewpub.

At Eudora, YOU are the brewmaster. Once our doors open, you'll have the opportunity to come in and brew your very own batch of beer in our brew-on-premise facility. You'll be able to schedule a brewing appointment or simply stop by to see if a kettle is available for brewing. A variety of recipes will be available to brew, and we plan on offering more styles as we grow. Whether you've brewed before or you have no idea what you're doing, we're here to guide you through every step of the process and make it as easy and as fun as possible. 

Eudora will also serve as a taproom, where we'll brew our own ales and lagers and serve them on draft. The pub will be open to brew-on-premise customers as well as the general public. We offer a variety of award-winning house-brewed beers as well as non-alcoholic beverages and a small selection of snacks.

Eudora will also donate a portion of EVERY sale toward funding a water project for those in need of clean water. We're teaming up with a group called Charity: Water whose mission is to end the water crisis happening all over the world. With each purchase you make at Eudora, you're helping Charity: Water build wells and water purification systems in villages, schools and clinics in areas where water is difficult to obtain. We use a TON of water in the brewing process. It's the least we can do to give back and do our part to fight the water crisis. With your help, we can change lives and help make the world a better place!

data.name: Sunrise Golden Ale
data.description: Sunrise Golden Ale is our lightest beer, but don't let that fool you. The malt is clean, light and crisp, with a slight sweetness. The aroma captures the distinct graininess of pilsner malt. Cascade and Mt. Hood hops balance the sweetness, contributing a slight citrus / spicy character. In the finish, the hops give way to a light maltiness. Overall, refreshing and clean, yet somewhat complex.

breweries.name: Equinox Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The most common question we get is, why Equinox Brewing? The equinox, and the intrigue of equal night and day, has deep roots in history and ritual. But, at the same time, the equinox marks the changing of the season, and forces us to look toward the future. We find it interesting that the two days out of the year that have perfect light and dark balance also show the balance between the past and the future, tradition and innovation. Beer contains similar elements. Sure, there’s the balance of flavors in a beer; sweet and bitter, rich and simple…

We find another aspect of beer’s balancing act fascinating. Historically, beer styles have developed because of limitations in local ingredients and the necessity to make do with what you have. However, due to global trade and modern shipping methods, limitations on ingredients have been removed. We can get any ingredients we want. While most modern brewers recognize the importance of beer styles and learn from the brewers who made them, they certainly don’t limit themselves to making beers that fit into traditional definitions.

On one level our beers fit into some traditional styles, but we put our own twist on them. We want our beers to capture elements from the past and incorporate new ideas, ingredients and techniques into them. We’re not afraid to try new things.

As a brewer, its playtime and work, balanced.

data.name: Sunshine Citrus Blonde
data.description: Living in Colorado, we’re lucky enough to get a taste of all the seasons. Some longer than others, but we can’t complain. One of our favorite times of year is spring. Mainly because it means winter is on its way out and summer is on its way in. We specifically crafted Sunshine Citrus Blonde with this transition season in mind. As we were moving on from the heavy, darker beers of winter, we started to crave a beer that would awaken our palates for the warmer weather ahead of us. That led us to use orange and lemon peel to give the beer a fresh citrus taste and wheat for a smooth malt character. It’s perfect for some long-awaited patio time.
data.foodPairings:
The citrus flavors complement light seasonal salads, pork dishes, and fruit-based desserts.
One of our favorite recipes to pair with Blue Moon® Sunshine Citrus Blonde is our Spring Spice-Rub Pork Loin.

One of our favorite recipes to pair with Sunshine Citrus Blonde is Blue Moon® Sunshine Citrus Blonde Spice-Rub Pork Loin

data.name: Sunspot Gold
data.description: Sunspot Golden Ale is an American take on a traditional Czech Pilsner that distinguishes itself by being infinitely drinkable. Brewed with fresh Czech Saaz hops and American Pale Barley, Sunspot Gold has a deep, rich golden color and delicate hop character. Americans have a habit of taking products and improving them. We believe this is especially true with our Sunspot Gold. The Brewers say they were just looking for something to go great with pizza!

breweries.name: SanTan Brewing Company
breweries.description:
In 2007, the historic Valley National Bank, in Downtown Chandler was transformed into a destination for Craft Beer and food lovers alike with the opening of SanTan Brewing Company. Our goal at the brewpub is to provide a neighborhood spot where family, friends, and colleagues can gather and enjoy a cold pint of freshly brewed beer using only the finest malts, hops, and barley!

In addition to our core beers on draught year round, Brewmaster Anthony Canecchia keeps things exciting for SanTan fans by releasing specialty seasonal beers, small batch specialty beers, a weekly Cask Conditioned Ale as well as guest beers from brewers both local and around the nation. Like the Brewmaster says “Craft Beer for Beer Drinking”.

breweries.name: Booze Brothers Brewing Co.
breweries.description:
Dave and Donny Firth started brewing beer like most folks do, with a microbrew kit. While these kits satisfy most home-brewers (the normal ones), The Firth Brothers quickly decided they just weren’t making enough beer. They had mouths to feed — their family’s, friend’s, friends of friend’s, friends of friends of friend’s, the occasional enemy’s, and their own — and so they had to go bigger. The Brothers saw no other option. Thousands of dollars later, their garage became a brewing frontier. They spent years crafting different styles of beers and used their guests as test dummies (no one minded). The Firth garage was a true underground experience — kegs stacked on kegs lined the walls, racks of replacement parts crowded the entryway, the smell of oil and somehow sawdust latched to everyone’s clothing, and a single torn couch was the only available seating. The guests never minded, though: the beer was always great. And the Brothers never seemed to mind when the get-togethers dragged into the early morning. Attracting lively, somewhat unruly people is what they had set out to do, but the walls of the garage seemed to be getting smaller each day.

Eventually, the Brothers asked the question: why don’t we open up a brewery? The reality of the idea, however, was riddled with frustrating technicalities, mostly concerning money and legal regulations. Their discussions of opening a brewery often trialed off into how to overthrow the government or rob banks. Once the dust of annoying logistics had finally settled (legally), the Brothers started shopping for buildings. They eventually agreed to pack their wagons and settle their equipment in 2545 Progress St.

What was once a huge empty room has become a rustic, good-ole’-days oasis that happens to make beer. Miss-matching, reclaimed wood lines the walk-in cooler and patio fence. Vintage hanging bulbs replaced the harsh florescent lighting. The bar is hand-crafted from wood, concrete, and iron. Even the bathrooms have style: they’re converted into what look like out-houses (don’t worry: the pluming still works). Booze Brothers Brewing Co. asks people to forget they are in the industrial area of Vista, and even more, that we are in living in the 2000s. Most important is that Booze Brothers Brewing Co. maintains the spirit of the original concept of the Firth garage — an underground (albeit legitimate) place for all types of people who should have at least one thing in common: a love for good beer.

breweries.name: Southern Prohibition Brewing
breweries.description: Southern Prohibition Brewing launched in April of 2013 with two simple goals: brew great beer and help make Mississippi a great place to live. Our 22,000 sq. ft. warehouse was a furniture showroom when originally constructed in 1941. After some renovations, the microbrewery in Downtown Hattiesburg houses a 20 barrel brewhouse. With three 60 barrel and four 40 barrel fermenters, Southern Prohibition currently has the capacity to produce 5,000 barrels a year.

breweries.name: Airways Brewing Company

Friendly service and tasty beer make us a favorite of locals as well as beer enthusiasts from all over. 

Special and seasonal beers make a frequent appearance. Our tap room has bar seating as well as small tables. On sunny days, garden seating is available.

Airways opened on March 4, 2010. Founder and brewer Alex Dittmar has had a lifelong passion for 60′s era jetliners. Airways is a combination of his love for airplanes, good beer, and a connection with people from all over the world.

breweries.name: Vertigo Brewing
breweries.description:
The early seeds of Vertigo Brewing were sown back in 1995 when Mike Haines and Mike Kinion began experimenting with brewing at U-Brew in Tigard, Oregon. But what began as a light hobby soon developed into a deep passion. They quickly outgrew the offerings of U-Brew and expanded their operation into a homebrew setup. Fifteen years later, the two Mikes have a lot of batches, awards, and experience under their belts. Starting in May of 2008, Vertigo Brewing was christened a fully-licensed brewery in a Hillsboro warehouse. 
Vertigo Brewing is currently operating a one barrel system, producing eight to ten barrels a month. But as demand takes off, the two Mikes are eagerly looking forward to an expanded business operation. Vertigo prides itself on producing a unique blend of beer offerings that manage to stand out in the beer-saturated market of the Northwest.

breweries.name: Border X Brewing
breweries.description: We created Border X Brewing as a vehicle to explore new flavors in craft beer. With over 85 breweries in San Diego in January of 2013, we knew that we wanted to add our own unique contribution to the beer scene. Having been raised on both sides of the border, we always enjoyed eating from both cultures.  Mexican Street Tacos, chile enfused candies, enchiladas one day, and Hamburgers, mac and cheese and ding dongs the next. As adults we realized how unique being raised on the border was, how the mix of flavors was seeping from north to south, and south to north. It was this fusion in flavors that inspired to take traditional, European brewing traditions and infuse the process with a whole new palette of Latin American ingredients.  So we dug into our own roots for inspiration and found a treasure trove of brewing traditions, ingredients and unique flavors.  Our best example of this is our Blood Saison, an agave and Hibiscus infused Saison that come off sweet initially, middle tartness and finishing like a beer.

breweries.name: Ei8ht Ball Brewing
breweries.description:
Ei8ht Ball, named after the streets we got our
credit from, we are humble yet proud. Local but not
influenced. We might not move mountains, but we will
push the envelope. We will test theories and create
moments through our liquid in which tones and times
are our muse. We will brew and flow with poise and
confidence. We will rush for no one, yet hesitate for
nothing. We strive to please but make no apologies. No
billboards, neon lights and flashy text, it’s not our speed.
Make us part of your flight or enjoy us with a meal and
the mission is complete. For all of those in search of
something diverse, unique, improved and fresh, look
into, behind, under and around the Ei8ht Ball. What you
will find is what you never thought you were looking for.
This is Ei8ht Ball Brewing, the proof is the glass.

breweries.name: Triton Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Operated by its member-managers, Jon W. Lang and David M. Waldman, Triton Brewing Company is a brewery producing high-quality craft beer for distribution in Indiana. 

Triton Brewing Company is a creative outlet in the form of a traditional, community-based production brewery located in the heartland of Indiana. The shareholders, employees, and libations of Triton Brewing Company embody exemplary strength of character, resolute integrity, and consistent quality in all their forms. We are dedicated to increasing a sense of fun and community through the creation of fine traditionally crafted ale and lager.

Beer and other beverages produced at our Indianapolis facility are available for sale throughout Indiana and Central Illinois. A tasting room at the brewery and a second tap room location provide other marketing opportunities.

Triton Brewing Company is the realization of the dream of Mr. Lang and Mr. Waldman that Indiana be a significant contributor to the world beer culture and can produce local beers that Hoosiers can be proud of and can purchase statewide.

data.name: Texas Backyard Blonde Ale
data.description: Brewed with the finest imported German malts and hops, using traditional German brewing techniques, the Texas Backyard Blonde Ale is inspired by the hoppy golden kolsch ales of Cologne.  More complex than your average blonde, bready, biscuity malt flavors combine with ample grassy, spicy hops and fruity esters in a crisp, refreshing brew, perfect for steamy Texas days.

breweries.name: The Bag and Kettle
breweries.description: Serving fine food and drink to the Sugarloaf area for more than forty years, has often been compared to a fine English pub.  While all affectionate flattery is graciously accepted, and most certainly appreciated, the management harbors certain reservations about being equated with most English pubs, the characteristics of which might not necessarily lend themselves to the western Maine mountain community.  Our prominent, esteemed, and highly experienced research team of Reynolds, Jones, Mulligan and Roy, have recently completed an extensive study of the supposed Anglo phenomenon, has concluded, and can unequivocally substantiate the following...

data.name: The Blonde AMBition
data.description: If there was a “Gateway” beer to convert all of the American Lager Lovers of the High Country to drink craft beer, this is it. You may call us naive for believing that everyone will stop drinking the “buds” and start drinking our craft brew. But we will just pour you a glass of this crisp, refreshing blonde ale and hope our ambition will overcome.

breweries.name: Appalachian Mountain Brewery
breweries.description:
The Appalachian Mountain Brewery (AMB) is a craft brewery located in the heart of North Carolina’s High Country. Home of the Appalachian State Mountaineers, Boone has countless outdoor activities at your fingertips: rock climbing, hiking, biking, kayaking, skiing, snowboarding, and more! AMB supplies fresh, flavorful beer to the High Country, while maintaining a strong emphasis on both sustainable values and the local community.

Although our craft is beer, AMB is much more than a brewery. Our founding principles go well beyond the pint glass and focus on ideals that strive to empower individuals, support local enterprise, and give back to the greater Appalachian region.  This can best be summarized in our motto:  ”Act Local. Drink Local.”

We will set a new precedent within the brewing industry through an intimate knowledge of the science behind sustainability and a strong desire to improve the current status quo in the field.  We will utilize photovoltaic solar panels, native rain gardens and wetlands, rain water harvesting, and local farm collaboration. Through these efforts AMB will make the highest quality beer while maintaining the highest quality of respect for not only the local community but also the planet at large.

Act Local. Drink Local.

data.name: The Crusher
data.description: A highly drinkable golden ale with lager-like qualities. Pilsner malts, noble hops imported from Germany and pure Napa Valley water are set to a cool ale fermentation and the result is a remarkably crisp, clean, “crushable” beer.

data.name: The Fitch Cask
data.description: The Fitch Cask is a very approachable pint and the lightest of our year-round brews. Imported Pilsner malt and a blend of lightly roasted grains provide a fresh malt flavor and the hops provide spicy flavors and a mild citrus note. The yeast strain we chose for this ale contributes light fruitiness and a clean and refreshing finish. The Fitch Cask won a Silver medal at the 2010 U.S. Open Beer Championship in the Blonde / Golden Ale Category.

breweries.name: Healdsburg Beer Co
breweries.description:
Founded in 2007, Healdsburg Beer Company is an independent and family owned brewery. We produce limited quantities of artisan cask ales using only the finest ingredients in laboriously attended to small lots. Seriously. 
Annual production for the brewery is less than 1,000 gallons and we sweat the details on each pint. Our brewing philosophy is grounded in the idea of balance. We strive to create beer that balances the flavors that we find in the malt, hops and yeast and create a layered, nuanced and flavorful beer that is still an easy drinking and friendly pint. 
Living in Sonoma County, it is difficult to think of any beverage without also thinking of food. Sonoma has an incredible food culture that includes some of the world’s finest artisan purveyors and restaurants. All of Healdsburg Beer Company’s beers are purposefully crafted to be friendly and complementary to a broad range of food.

data.name: THE FULL LEMONTY
data.description: Optimism is great and all, but sometimes in order to open and operate a brewery in Lemont, you need to go “The Full Lemonty.” A crisp and clean golden ale brewed with white wheat, Belgian aromatic malts, and a blend of American hops leaving a delicate bitterness to balance the subtle, underlying sweetness. Both a gateway beer for new craft beer fans and an all-day sipper for the vet, this is something everyone can enjoy.

breweries.name: Pollyanna Brewing Company
breweries.description:
"Pollyanna" is defined as irrepressibly optimistic. It reflects the idea of finding something to be glad about in every situation.

Opening a production brewery and taproom is a time consuming and calculated process that certainly requires plenty of optimism. We want to share with you our beer, our passion, and the optimistic approach that has led us to this point.

We're excited to build new memories and experiences as well as enrich our local community by always keeping the glass half-full. We're opening soon, so hang tight!

data.name: The Governor
data.description: Named after several early governors who promoted the advancement of beer brewing in the early colony of Sydney. From Governor Bligh and the infamous mutiny off HMS Bounty and his controversial resignation as the NSW Governor after the Rum Rebellion, to Governor Phillip King who was prompted by Lord Hobart to import brewing materials to try and stem the rum currency in the early colony. Even before the first Governors could restrict the future drinking culture of the young colony, Captain Cook was already brewing beer on his way to the new country on board the Endeavour in 1770. Beer was always destined to be the drink of choice for the Australian people.

breweries.name: Rocks Brewing Company
breweries.description:
We are an Australian-owned and operated brewery lead by fifth and sixth generation convict descendants. Our craft beers will bring to life the true stories of early Australian convicts and settlers, beginning with traditional, great tasting ales - just like your grandfathers’ grandfather drank.

Rocks Brewing Co beers will amaze beer lovers with their complex and sophisticated flavours, which are achieved while staying true to our simple brewing process -
“Nothing but Barley, Hops, Water & Yeast.”

Our first batch of Red Ale was brewed September 2008. Since then we have created plenty of other beers, along with a cider.

Rocks beers are currently available on tap in selected pubs and restaurants as well as in bottles at good craft beer retailers. Keep an eye out for our distinctive logos on the taps and in the fridges of all good drinking establishments, we're bound to be there.

data.name: The Illuminated Blonde
data.description: Reminiscent of the German style Kölsch with its pale straw/gold color. This blonde ale is an easy drinking beer because of its light malty palate, medium bitterness, and dry finish. You will pick up nice earthy characteristics from the noble hops. Overall, it’s just a nice balanced beer—light bodied, and refreshing.

breweries.name: Legacy Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The Brewer, Mark Mericle:
Mark's legacy is quite simple. While visiting relatives in Bavaria, Germany and having traveled numerous times to the great brewing countries of the UK and Europe, Mark came to this simple conclusion, “American beers are boring and just are not very satisfying”. In Europe and the UK every area had its own local brewery and the beer was fresh and had flavor and a lot of body. So his quest to bring premium fresh flavorful beers to his town was born.

Working as an apprentice with some of the original craft brewers in California, it gave him an a working knowledge and appreciation as well as insight into the business of craft beer. Heritage Brewing was co-founded by Mark in 1989 and was Orange County’s first micro brewery (brewpub) and they also became known as the premier live blues venue in the OC. Several years later Mark founded his production facility in Riverside County and produced products under Heritage’s label as well as producing white label products for restaurants such as Claim Jumper, Wahoo’s, BJ’s Pizza, etc. In addition, Mark's facility produced and packaged many bottled products that have sold in all major retailers throughout So Cal.

Mark has brewed on various systems from 7bbl to 110 bbl, as well as installations and recipe formulations for many local brewpubs. Mark has received numerous awards from local beer festivals, state fairs, national and international beer festivals. Having received over 20 awards ranging from best of show, blue ribbons, bronze, silver and gold, with a Gold medal at the Great American Beer Festival, you can rest assured that the philosophy surrounding Mark, is a quality product every time. Mark's Nut Brown Ale was also celebrated in Michael Jacksons world pocket guide to beer as “world class” .
